required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of BCMA-directed CAR-T Cells Treatment in Subjects With r/r Multiple Myeloma
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase # Study Evaluating Safety and Efficacy of C-CAR088 Treatment in Subjects With Relapsed or Refractory Multiple Myeloma

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-center, non-randomized study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of C-CAR088 in relapsed or refractory multiple myeloma patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The study will include the following sequential phases: Screening, Apheresis, Baseline, Pre-Treatment (Cell Product Preparation, Lymphodepleting Chemotherapy), C-CAR088 infusion and Follow-up Visit.

primary_outcome.measure: The Incidence of adverse events (TEAEs) within 30 days after intravenous infusion of C-CAR088

secondary_outcome.description: ORR(including sCR / CR / VGPR / PR, based on IMWG 2016 efficacy evaluation criteria)
PFS(based on IMWG 2016 efficacy evaluation criteria)

arm_group.description: Lymphocytes will be transduced with lentiviral vector containing CAR-BCMA gene

intervention.description: Autologous BCMA-directed CAR-T cells, single infusion intravenously at a target dose of 1.0-9.0 x 10^6 anti-BCMA CAR+T cells/kg. Other Name: CBM.BCMA Chimeric Antigen Receptor T cell.
